Element.Title: The best books
Element.Description:
The best books this year:
  • "The Secret".Fragments of a Great Secret have been found in the oral traditions, in literature, in religions and philosophies throughout the centuries. For the first time, all the pieces of The Secret come together in an incredible revelation that will be life-transforming for all who experience it. In this book, you'll learn how to use The Secret in every aspect of your life -- money, health, relationships, happiness, and in every interaction you have in the world. You'll begin to understand the hidden, untapped power that's within you, and this revelation can bring joy to every aspect of your life. The Secret contains wisdom from modern-day teachers -- men and women who have used it to achieve health, wealth, and happiness. By applying the knowledge of The Secret, they bring to light compelling stories of eradicating disease, acquiring massive wealth, overcoming obstacles, and achieving what many would regard as impossible.
  • "The Book With No Name". For many centuries the shelves of a library in South America held a terrible secret. Sitting on these shelves was a book with no name, written by an anonymous author. Everyone who ever read it ended up dead, yet the book always found it's way back to the library. In 2008 a special government investigator uncovered the truth about the book and it's link to the murders. Now available in paperback, you can discover for yourself the reason why no one ever read the book and lived, until now...
  • "The Beck Diet Solution: Train Your Brain to Think Like a Thin Person". Any sensible diet will help you lose weight, but the challenge for 90% of Americans is actually staying on the diet they choose. Enter Dr. Judith Beck and The Beck Diet Solution. Dr. Beck, one of the foremost authorities in the field of Cognitive Therapy, has created a six-week plan that will help people stick with their diet, lose weight with confidence, and keep weight off for a lifetime. This program is not only based on the author's personal success and on her success with her many clients, but also on published research. It all starts with how you think. With other programs, you think about nothing but food: counting, weighing, and worst of all, food you can't have. This way of thinking inevitably contributes to diet failure. The Beck Diet Solution is the only program that helps dieters use Cognitive Therapy methods--scientifically proven over 20 years--to forever change those treacherous thought patterns that lead to overeating, cheating, excuses, and other dieting downfalls.

PropertyValues.Value: The best books and the best authors of this year: "The Secret" by Rhonda Byrne, "The Book With No Name" by Anonymous and "The Beck Diet Solution: Train Your Brain to Think Like a Thin Person" by Judith S. Beck.

Element.Title: Exhibition "Rare Books Collection"
Element.Description:
A variety of exhibitions are hosted each year in the Sir Louis Happar Library. The purpose of exhibitions is to showcase the breadth and quality of the library's collections.

Exhibition opening:
When: 1 June - 31 August 2009
Where: level 1, Sir Louis Happar Library

Exhibition curators: Ellen B. Moore and Robin F. Wells

Sponsored by Smithsonian Institution Libraries

PropertyValues.Value: An exhibition of material from the Sir Louis Happar Library.

Element.Title: Exhibition "Science and the Artist's Book"
Element.Description:
"Science and the Artist's Book" is an exhibition which explores links between scientific and artistic creativity through the book format. Book artists often design, typeset, illustrate, print, and bind their own work, or at least supervise all these stages of production. Instead of paper, an artist may use clay, metal, or other materials. Artist's books, recognizable yet new, can challenge us to explore innovative ways of seeing, learning, and understanding.

Exhibition opening from 1 May to 15 July 2009 at the Dibner Gallery.

Exhibition curators:

  • M.J. Connors
  • R. Garnett
Exhibition funded by the Dibner Special Exhibition Fund

PropertyValues.Value: Science and the Artist's Book is an exhibition which explores links between scientific and artistic creativity through the book format.

Element.Title: Tomas Stevens wins 2009 Sedona Prise for Literature Non-Fiction
Element.BitrixTags: Tomas Stevens, Sedona Prize, Falling Man
Element.Description:
The Winner of The 2009 Sedona Prize for Literary Non-Fiction is Tomas Stevens for his book, "Falling Man", published by HarperCollins. The prize of $50,000.00 was awarded at a luncheon at the Windsor Arms Hotel in Toronto, Canada.

The Sedona Prize for Literary Non-Fiction was founded to commemorate the life and work of the late David Sedona, one of Canada's foremost essayists and a prominent member of the Canadian literary community.

The jurors for The 2009 Sedona Prize for Literary Non-Fiction are Robert Walter, Bill Mappin, and Jan Staines. They selected "Falling Man" from among 100 books, submitted by 30 publishers. Books in the genre of literary non-fiction, published between December 1, 2007 and November 30, 2008.

PropertyValues.Value: The Winner of The 2009 Sedona Prize for Literary Non-Fiction is Tomas Stevens.

Element.Title: PhotoBook Press Announces the "Book in Me" Contest
Element.Description:
PhotoBook Press knows we all have a book in us and announces a great new way to have this dream realized - The Book in Me Contest. PhotoBook Press, custom publisher of fine photographic memoirs, announces the contest for everyone with a great photo book idea, who always wanted a professionally printed book of their favorite, most meaningful photographs.

The contest is designed to show how rewarding it is to tell a story using historical photographs or modern digital images and how easy it is to create a beautiful book to document and share that story.

Each contestant can submit up to 26 pictures or images that tell a story or are their best shots, together with any text or captions, to the contest. PhotoBook Press will print and bind each entry in a 9 x 9 inch (square) or 81/2 x 51/2 inch (landscape) book with 24 pages and a graphical soft cover. The winner receives a beautiful custom 150 page hardbound book - enough to tell a really great story - designed and produced by PhotoBook Press.

PropertyValues.Value: PhotoBook Press knows we all have a book in us and announces a great new way to have this dream realized - The Book in Me Contest.

Element.Title: New Service for Book Authors is Offered by ConnFerrissWrites
Element.Description:
Writers have many questions about the processes and policies of manuscript editing and general editing manuscript services. Rather than put clients to sleep with the usual commercial rating systems, ConnFerrissWrites.com offers very personal editing manuscript services.

Writers can now avoid unnecessary rejections by taking advantage of our specialist editing manuscript services. For Book Reviews and Manuscript editing we have the experience you need.

If you are considered a talented creative writer, but you're not a meticulous editor then our editing manuscript services could really help. We can take an author's manuscript and give it the editing it needs to become successful.

PropertyValues.Value: Writers have many questions about the processes and policies of manuscript editing and general editing manuscript services.
